intro: Spermacoce felis-insulae, commonly known as the island velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically followed by spherical, woody fruits. Spermacoce felis-insulae is native to tropical regions and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural interest.
